sentences.english: Can I borrow your pen for a minute?
sentences.chinese: 我可以借你的笔用一下吗？

sentences.english: They borrowed heavily (=  borrowed a lot of money  ) from the bank to start their new business.
sentences.chinese: 他们向银行贷了巨款来创办新公司。

detailed_translations.english: to use something that belongs to someone else and that you must give back to them later

sentences.english: The hospital agreed to lend us a wheelchair.
sentences.chinese: 医院同意借给我们一把轮椅。

sentences.english: The bank is reassessing its criteria for lending money.
sentences.chinese: 银行正在重新评估其贷款标准。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone borrow money or something that belongs to you for a short time

sentences.english: It was forty five minutes before she returned.
sentences.chinese: 过了45分钟她才回来。

sentences.english: Alison decided to return home.
sentences.chinese: 艾利森决定回家。

sentences.english: He left his country, never to return.
sentences.chinese: 他离开了祖国，一去不复返。

detailed_translations.english: to go or come back to a place where you were before
the act of returning from somewhere, or your arrival back in a place
used or paid for a journey from one place to another and back again

sentences.english: I’ve just started reading a book by Graham Greene.
sentences.chinese: 我刚开始看格雷厄姆·格林写的一本书。

sentences.english: a cookery book
sentences.chinese: 烹饪书

sentences.english: Have you booked a holiday this year?
sentences.chinese: 你今年有没有预订去度假？

detailed_translations.english: a set of printed pages that are held together in a cover so that you can read them
to make arrangements to stay in a place, eat in a restaurant, go to a theatre etc at a particular time in the future

sentences.english: Do you have to reserve tickets in advance?
sentences.chinese: 你必须预先订票吗？

detailed_translations.english: to arrange for a place in a hotel, restaurant, plane etc to be kept for you to use at a particular time in the future

detailed_translations.chinese: 储备； 保留； 拘谨， 矜持； 替补队员， 后备部队； 自然保护区
detailed_translations.english: a supply of something kept to be used if it is needed

sentences.english: They retired to another room for private consultation.
sentences.chinese: 他们退到另一房间秘密磋商。

sentences.english: This is a critical question that we must answer together through consultation and coordination.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个我们必须通过磋商和协调共同回答的关键问题。

detailed_translations.english: a discussion in which people who are affected by or involved in something can give their opinions

sentences.english: Reese, by his own admission , lacks the necessary experience.
sentences.chinese: 里斯自己也承认缺乏必要的经验。

sentences.english: No admission after 10 pm.
sentences.chinese: 晚上10点以后免进。

sentences.english: The Museum has no admission charge .
sentences.chinese: 那家博物馆不收门票。

detailed_translations.chinese: 承认；准许进(加)入；入场费
detailed_translations.english: a statement in which you admit that something is true or that you have done something wrong

sentences.english: He wondered if the girl behind the counter recognised him.
sentences.chinese: 他在想柜台后面的那个女孩是否认出了他。

sentences.english: Set the video counter to zero before you press play.
sentences.chinese: 在按播放键之前，把录像机上的计数器调到零。

detailed_translations.english: the place where you pay or are served in a shop, bank, restaurant etc

sentences.english: shelves of books
sentences.chinese: 一层层书架的书

sentences.english: supermarket shelves
sentences.chinese: 超级市场的货架

sentences.english: the amount of shelf space available
sentences.chinese: 可用的货架空间

detailed_translations.english: a long flat narrow board attached to a wall or in a frame or cupboard, used for putting things on

sentences.english: The staff were very good.
sentences.chinese: 员工们都很棒。

sentences.english: 10 staff were allocated to the task.
sentences.chinese: 10名员工被分派做这项任务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 全体职员，员工；工作人员；参谋
detailed_translations.english: the people who work for an organization

sentences.english: The new librarian is a friend of mine.
sentences.chinese: 这位新来的图书管理员是我的朋友。

detailed_translations.english: someone who works in a library

sentences.english: people in the over-45 age category
sentences.chinese: 属45岁以上年龄组的人

sentences.english: Seats are available in eight of the ten price categories .
sentences.chinese: 座位共有10种票价，现有8种可售。

sentences.english: Williams’ style does not fit easily into the category of jazz.
sentences.chinese: 威廉斯的风格不能轻易归入爵士乐的范畴。

detailed_translations.english: a group of people or things that are all of the same type

sentences.english: the classification of wines according to quality
sentences.chinese: 葡萄酒按品质的分类

sentences.english: There are five job classifications.
sentences.chinese: 有五种工作类别。

detailed_translations.english: a process in which you put something into the group or class it belongs to

sentences.english: "Patience and Sarah" was first published in 1969 under the title "A Place for Us."
sentences.chinese: 《耐心与萨拉》于1969年以《我们的地方》为书名首次出版。

sentences.english: Pirandello titled his play "Six Characters in Search of an Author."
sentences.chinese: 皮兰德娄将其戏剧命名为《六个寻找作者的剧中人》。

sentences.english: The single is titled "White Love."
sentences.chinese: 这支单曲名为《白色之恋》。

detailed_translations.chinese: 冠军；标题；头衔；权利；字幕
detailed_translations.english: the name given to a particular book, painting, play etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 加标题于；赋予头衔；把…称为
detailed_translations.english: When a writer, composer, or artist titles a work, they give it a name

sentences.english: Nothomb is a Belgian author.
sentences.chinese: 诺东是位比利时作家。

sentences.english: It’s clear that the author is a woman.
sentences.chinese: 显然，这位作者是女性。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has written a book

sentences.english: ...the consumer price index.
sentences.chinese: …消费价格指数。

detailed_translations.english: a standard by which the level of something can be judged or measured

sentences.english: I’m always working under pressure to meet deadlines (= finish something on time ) .
sentences.chinese: 我总是在赶工期的压力下工作。

detailed_translations.english: a date or time by which you have to do or complete something

sentences.english: My passport expires next week.
sentences.chinese: 我的护照下周就到期了。

sentences.english: Ophelia expires in Act IV of Hamlet.
sentences.chinese: 奥菲莉娅在《哈姆雷特》第四幕中死去。

detailed_translations.english: (of a document, an agreement, etc.) to be no longer valid because the period of time for which it could be used has ended

sentences.english: The United Mine Workers are not on strike today, despite the expiry of their contract at midnight.
sentences.chinese: 联合矿业工会今天没有罢工，尽管他们的合同于午夜期满。

detailed_translations.english: The expiry of something such as a contract, deadline, or visa is the time that it comes to an end or stops being valid

sentences.english: You don’t happen to recall his name, do you?
sentences.chinese: 你不会恰巧还想得起他的名字吧？

sentences.english: As I recall, it was you who suggested this idea in the first place.
sentences.chinese: 我记得，是你首先提出这个想法的。

sentences.english: Cole was recalled to the squad to replace the injured Quinn.
sentences.chinese: 科尔被召回队里代替受伤的奎因。

sentences.english: The cars had to be recalled due to an engine fault.
sentences.chinese: 由于发动机缺陷，那些汽车必须召回。

detailed_translations.english: to remember a particular fact, event, or situation from the past

sentences.english: The window frames need to be renewed.
sentences.chinese: 窗框需要换新的。

detailed_translations.english: to remove something that is old or broken and put a new one in its place
to begin doing something again after a period of not doing it

sentences.english: Mark’s contract comes up for renewal at the end of this year.
sentences.chinese: 马克的合同将在今年年末到期，需要续签。

detailed_translations.chinese: 更新，恢复；复兴；补充；革新；续借；重申
detailed_translations.english: when an activity, situation, or process begins again after a period when it had stopped

sentences.english: The team are due to fly to Italy next month.
sentences.chinese: 该球队预定下个月飞往意大利。

sentences.english: Any money due you will be sent by cheque through the post.
sentences.chinese: 应该支付给你的款项将会以支票邮寄给你。

detailed_translations.english: expected to happen or arrive at a particular time

sentences.english: an overdue gas bill
sentences.chinese: 逾期未付的煤气账单

sentences.english: The library books are overdue.
sentences.chinese: 图书馆的书过期未还。

sentences.english: The baby was a week overdue (= it was expected to be born a week ago ).
sentences.chinese: 宝宝超过预产期有一周了。

detailed_translations.english: not done, paid, returned etc by the time expected

sentences.english: Many people regard Beethoven’s fifth symphony as his finest work.
sentences.chinese: 很多人认为贝多芬的第五交响曲是他最杰出的作品。

sentences.english: He’s a very fine player.
sentences.chinese: 他是个很优秀的选手。

sentences.english: It’s a fine idea.
sentences.chinese: 这是个很妙的主意。

sentences.english: Hatfield House is a fine example of Jacobean architecture.
sentences.chinese: 哈特菲尔德宅第是英王詹姆斯一世时期建筑的典范。

sentences.english: The restaurant was chosen for its good food and fine wines .
sentences.chinese: 这家餐厅因其美酒佳肴而入选。

detailed_translations.english: very good or of a very high standard

sentences.english: Tickets are available from the box office.
sentences.chinese: 售票处有票出售。

sentences.english: Meetings were held to update employees as soon as new information became available .
sentences.chinese: 一有新的信息就开会告诉员工。

sentences.english: Further building can continue when money is made available .
sentences.chinese: 有了资金就可以继续进一步的施工。

sentences.english: Every available space on the wall was covered in pictures.
sentences.chinese: 墙上每一个可用的地方都挂上了画。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可利用的，现有的；可获得的
detailed_translations.english: something that is available is able to be used or can easily be bought or found

sentences.english: Exercise improves the circulation.
sentences.chinese: 运动能促进血液循环。

sentences.english: The Treasury Department plans to remove older coins from circulation and replace them with new ones.
sentences.chinese: 财政部打算收回市面上流通的旧版硬币，以新版取代。

detailed_translations.chinese: 血液循环；（资料、货币等）流通
detailed_translations.english: the movement of blood around your body

sentences.english: We stock a wide range of kitchen equipment.
sentences.chinese: 我们备有各种厨房用品。

detailed_translations.english: if a shop stocks a particular product, it keeps a supply of it to sell
something that is available in a shop and does not have to be ordered

detailed_translations.chinese: 原料，库存品；股本，公债；世系，血统；汤汁；家畜，牲畜
detailed_translations.english: a liquid made by boiling meat or bones and vegetables, which is used to make soups or to add  flavour  to other dishes

sentences.english: We obtained a loan from the government.
sentences.chinese: 我们得了一笔政府贷款。

sentences.english: If you ask him for a loan, he'll come through.
sentences.chinese: 如果你向他贷款，他会满足你的要求的。

sentences.english: The company won't keep going unless we can get some loan.
sentences.chinese: 除非我们能搞到贷款，否则公司就维持不下去了。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that you borrow from a bank etc
